title: MRR Growth Forecaster
description: Model your SaaS growth and revenue scenarios
prompt:
Create a SaaS revenue forecast model.

Current MRR: [AMOUNT]
Growth Rate: [PERCENT]
Churn Rate: [PERCENT]
Timeframe: [12/24 Months]

Calculate:
1. Monthly MRR progression
2. Total ARR by end of period
3. Impact of reducing churn by 1%
4. Impact of increasing growth by 5%

Provide a summary of the "Best Case" vs "Worst Case" scenarios.

title: Feature Prioritization Matrix (RICE)
description: Decide what to build next using the RICE framework
prompt:
Help me prioritize these features using the RICE score.

Features: [LIST FEATURES]

For each, estimate (1-10 scale):
- Reach (How many users will it impact?)
- Impact (How much will it help them?)
- Confidence (How sure are we?)
- Effort (How hard is it to build? - Inverse score)

Calculate RICE Score = (Reach x Impact x Confidence) / Effort.
Rank them from highest to lowest.

title: User Onboarding Flow Designer
prompt:
Design a user onboarding flow for [PRODUCT].

Goal: Get user to [AHA MOMENT] in < 5 minutes.

Steps:
1. Sign-up (Fields to ask)
2. Welcome Screen (Value prop)
3. Setup Wizard (Critical steps only)
4. The "First Win" action
5. Email 1 trigger

Identify potential friction points to remove.

title: Competitor Analysis Battlecard
description: Analyze competitors to find your edge
prompt:
Create a competitor battlecard for [COMPETITOR].

My Product: [NAME]
Competitor: [NAME]

Compare:
1. Pricing (Cheaper/More expensive?)
2. Key Features (What do they have that we don't?)
3. Weaknesses (What do users complain about?)
4. Our Unique Selling Proposition (Where we win)
5. "Kill Shot" argument (One sentence to win the deal)

title: SaaS Pricing Strategy Generator
description: Optimize your pricing tiers for maximum revenue
prompt:
Develop a pricing strategy for [PRODUCT].

Value Metric: [Seats/Usage/Features]
Target Customer: [SMB/Enterprise]

Create 3 Tiers:
1. Starter (Low barrier to entry)
2. Pro (The "Sweet Spot" - most value)
3. Enterprise (Custom/High touch)

Define features, limits, and price points for each. Explain the psychology behind the structure.

title: Churn Survey Analyzer
description: Understand why users leave to fix the bucket
prompt:
Analyze these churn reasons and suggest fixes.

Reasons:
1. "Too expensive" (40%)
2. "Missing feature X" (30%)
3. "Hard to use" (20%)
4. "Project ended" (10%)

For each:
- Is it a product, pricing, or positioning issue?
- What is the immediate fix?
- What is the long-term fix?

title: Product Launch Checklist
description: Don't miss a step when shipping new features
prompt:
Create a checklist for launching [FEATURE].

Teams involved: Product, Eng, Marketing, Support.

Items:
- Technical (QA, Deployment)
- Marketing (Blog, Email, Social)
- Enablement (Help docs, Internal training)
- Success (Metrics to track)

Timeline: T-minus 2 weeks to Launch Day.
